inscription: ほのぼのとあかし野浦の朝霧にしまがくれ行くふねをしぞおもふ {Honobono to / Akashi no ura no / asagiri ni / shima kagureyuku / fune oshi zo omou}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
text:
Kakinomoto Hitomaro (died 708) is venerated by the Japanese as one of their earliest poets. The inscribed poem is taken from the anthology Kokin Wakashū (Collection of Japanese Poems of Ancient and Modern Times) from c. 905.

Into the mist, glowing with dawn
across the Bay of Akashi
a boat carries my thoughts
into hiding
islands beyond

(transl. Lewis Cook)
title: Poem by Kakinomoto Hitomaro
